intro: Rhexia crenulata, commonly known as the smoothleaf bearded bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its small, showy pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family, which includes carnivorous plants. Its leaves are typically smooth and have a distinctive bearded appearance on the lower surface. Rhexia crenulata thrives in wet, acidic soils and is often found in marshes and swamps.
